FuncDef:
The leaf command specifies the device as a leaf node for a P2MP tunnel on a multicast VPLS network and displays the VSI-Inclusive-Leaf view.
The undo leaf command restores the default configuration.
By default, no device is specified as a leaf node on a multicast VPLS network.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
On a multicast VPLS network, a P2MP tunnel can have multiple leaf nodes but only one root node. To specify a leaf node and enter the VSI-Inclusive-Leaf view so that you can configure the leaf node, run the leaf command.
Prerequisites
The VSI-Inclusive view has been created and has been displayed using the inclusive-provider-tunnel command.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the primary-root backup-root command to specify the primary and backup P2MP tunnels in dual-root protection scenarios in which P2MP tunnels are configured.
Precautions
Running the undo leaf command deletes a leaf node and all configurations of the leaf node. Exercise caution when running the undo leaf command.
